sense.name: sea movement
sense.commentary: TIDE[+event] the periodic rise and fall of the sea level under the gravitational pull of the moon
sense.examples: She planned her beachcombing day around the tides. The sharks come and go with the tides. The children aren't allowed to go swimming until low tide.

sense.name: other rising and falling
sense.commentary: something that may increase or decrease (like the tides of the sea)
sense.examples: A rising tide of popular interest made the venture successful.

sense.name: lunar time period
sense.examples: There are usually two high tides and two low tides each day. They high tide will be in the morning.
